content:
• Wednesday, August 15, 2012
  • MIPS

    More on MIPS Technologies (NASDAQ:MIPS): FQ4 earnings beat on the bottom line, but come up...

    More on MIPS Technologies (NASDAQ:MIPS): FQ4 earnings beat on the bottom line, but come up slightly short on the top line, in spite of a big jump in total revenue. Revenue from royalties was $10.6M, license revenue $27.8M, including its Broadcom license. Licensee royalty units grew to 708M units from 656M units in FY'11. Shares +1.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • HOTT

    More on Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT): Q2 results miss estimates, despite losses narrowing on better...

    More on Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT): Q2 results miss estimates, despite losses narrowing on better overall revenue an margins. Gross margin widened to 34.1% from 32.2%, as overhead expenses fell 6.2%. Shares -3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM
  • A

    More on Agilent's FQ3: Weak results are blamed on the company entering "an environment of much...

    More on Agilent's FQ3: Weak results are blamed on the company entering "an environment of much slower growth," leading to delayed orders and deal closings. Electronic measurement orders -4% Y/Y, Life Sciences -2%, Chemical Analysis -7%. Agilent expects FQ4 revenue of $1.76B-$1.78B and EPS of $0.80-$0.82, worse than a consensus of $1.87B and $0.97. A -7.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA): Q2 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $126.9M (+11% Y/Y) misses by...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA): Q2 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $126.9M (+11% Y/Y) misses by $0.4M. Expects Q3 revenue of $145M-$148M, in-line with $147.3M consensus. Shares +3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • CSCO

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) guides on its FQ4 earnings call (webcast) for FQ1 revenue to grow 2%-4% Y/Y,...

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) guides on its FQ4 earnings call (webcast) for FQ1 revenue to grow 2%-4% Y/Y, in-line with a consensus for 3.6% growth. EPS is expected be in a range of $0.45-$0.47, in-line with a $0.46 consensus. Shares +3.7% AH. Other networking names are up slightly.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • ATLC

    CompuCredit (CCRT) +42% AH following news of its tender offer to purchase up to 8.25M shares of...

    CompuCredit (CCRT) +42% AH following news of its tender offer to purchase up to 8.25M shares of its common stock for $10/share; shares closed today at $5.02.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • LB

    Limited Brands (LTD): Q2 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.4B (-2.4% Y/Y) in-line....

    Limited Brands (LTD): Q2 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.4B (-2.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • A

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A): FQ3 EPS of $0.79 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $1.72B (+2% Y/Y)...

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A): FQ3 EPS of $0.79 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $1.72B (+2% Y/Y) misses by $70M. Shares -6.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • HOTT

    Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT): Q2 EPS of -$0.02 in-line. Revenue of $157.8M (+4.6% Y/Y) misses by...

    Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT): Q2 EPS of -$0.02 in-line. Revenue of $157.8M (+4.6% Y/Y) misses by $1.5M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT): FQ3 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.34B (-16% Y/Y)...

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT): FQ3 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.34B (-16% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): FQ1 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.45B in-line. Shares +7.4%...

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): FQ1 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.45B in-line. Shares +7.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +11.8%) is among the day's top gainers after shares are initiated with a Buy...

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +11.8%) is among the day's top gainers after shares are initiated with a Buy rating and a $17 price target at BB&T.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • CE

    Celanese (CE +3.7%) rises even as shares are cut to Hold from Buy at Dahlman Rose, which...

    Celanese (CE +3.7%) rises even as shares are cut to Hold from Buy at Dahlman Rose, which believes near-term fundamentals are likely to stay challenging over coming quarters due to economic uncertainties in Europe and slower Asian growth. The firm also sees less visibility in CE's growth profile.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • VEON

    VimpelCom (VIP +9.6%) soars in afternoon trading on news that Russia's Alfa Group has increased...

    VimpelCom (VIP +9.6%) soars in afternoon trading on news that Russia's Alfa Group has increased its voting stake in the carrier to 40.5% from a prior 25%, courtesy of a $3.6B purchase from Egyptian tycoon Naguib Sawiris. Alfa's stake now surpasses the 39.5% stake held by Norwegian carrier Telenor, whose efforts to increase its position have produced a hostile regulatory response. Alfa, which wants to buy more shares, expects Telenor to raise its stake to 43%. (VIP Q2 results)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • HRC

    Hill-Rom (HRC +5.8%) trade up today after Kinetic Concepts sold its competing Therapeutic...

    Hill-Rom (HRC +5.8%) trade up today after Kinetic Concepts sold its competing Therapeutic Support Systems unit to Getinge AB for around $275M. The valuation of the acquisition, along with speculation that HRC could become a takeover target appears to be what's driving the move.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • DNDN

    Shares of Dendreon (DNDN +6.4%) spike higher on a spate of short covering in the face of more...

    Shares of Dendreon (DNDN +6.4%) spike higher on a spate of short covering in the face of more takeover rumors.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • CLLZF

    Connacher Oil and Gas (OTCPK:CLLZF -12.1%) says it will sell its Montana refinery to Calumet...

    Connacher Oil and Gas (OTCPK:CLLZF -12.1%) says it will sell its Montana refinery to Calumet Specialty Products (CLMT +1%) for ~$120M plus working capital, a deal that adds crude oil throughput capacity of ~9,800 bbl/day for CLMT. Connacher, deeply in debt, hopes the asset sale will enable it to survive long enough to find a buyer for the Canadian company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -3.9%) slumps after delivering its Q2 report. Revenue, courtesy of a mobile app...

    Vringo (VRNG -3.9%) slumps after delivering its Q2 report. Revenue, courtesy of a mobile app business that has become a sideshow, totaled just $100K, while net loss amounted to $0.36/share. Earlier today, SA's Patrick Anderson questioned whether Vringo's patent-purchase deal with Nokia will pay off, given licensing restrictions, required royalty payments to Nokia, and the fact Nokia already has a licensing deal with Apple.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • OGXPY

    OGX Petroleum (OTCPK:OGXPY -5.2%) tumbles after the Brazilian company reports a ~$200M Q2 loss,...

    OGX Petroleum (OTCPK:OGXPY -5.2%) tumbles after the Brazilian company reports a ~$200M Q2 loss, nearly triple the loss in the year-ago period, blaming a $167M forex loss after the real depreciated more than 10% vs. the dollar. Results also were hit by lower-than-expected production at the Tubarao Azul field, where a well had to be shuttered to replace equipment.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +8.7%) surges after beating FQ4 estimates and providing healthy guidance....

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +8.7%) surges after beating FQ4 estimates and providing healthy guidance. During its earnings call, JDS noted demand for 40G/100G optical components is growing rapidly - a positive for Ciena (CIEN +2.8%) - and hinted it has signed a new development contract with Microsoft. MKM believes JDS is gaining component share and is attractively valued, but Needham thinks a lot still depends on Q4 carrier budgets. FNSR +5.6%. OPLK +1.9%. NPTN +4.6%. OCLR +2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell Technologies (MXWL +3.3%) spikes higher after it's learned CEO David Schramm bought 10K...

    Maxwell Technologies (MXWL +3.3%) spikes higher after it's learned CEO David Schramm bought 10K shares today at a price of $7.73. Maxwell has had a rough year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR +2%) trades up today after being mentioned positively at BofA/Merrill. The firm...

    Questcor (QCOR +2%) trades up today after being mentioned positively at BofA/Merrill. The firm says that after taking a meeting with Momenta (NASDAQ:MNTA), it's convinced a generic version of QCOR's Acthar is unlikely near-term. Concerns over competition for Acthar have been a deep overhang on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • COO

    Cooper Cos. (COO +4.4%) moves up after JPMorgan raised it to Overweight earlier today on...

    Cooper Cos. (COO +4.4%) moves up after JPMorgan raised it to Overweight earlier today on valuation, citing expectations for a strong second half.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • WLTW

    Towers Watson (TW +5.5%) regains some of the territory it lost over yesterdays Q2 earnings...

    Towers Watson (TW +5.5%) regains some of the territory it lost over yesterdays Q2 earnings drubbing. William Blair says that it thinks the sell-off was overdone. The results were "neither as weak as they first appear nor a sign of a longer‐term structural issue." The firm reiterates its Outperform rating on the stock. (Transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • QCOM

    Evercore's Mark McKechnie starts Qualcomm (QCOM +0.2%) and InvenSense (INVN +4.5%) at...

    Evercore's Mark McKechnie starts Qualcomm (QCOM +0.2%) and InvenSense (INVN +4.5%) at Overweight. McKechnie sees Qualcomm benefiting from rising sales of 3G/4G notebooks and tablets, and predicts its chip margins, hurt by 28nm yield issues and high R&D spending, will eventually rebound. As for InvenSense, he considers its MEMS motion sensor chips differentiated from rival solutions, and forecasts huge unit growth. Research In Motion and Nokia have been started at Equal weight.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • STZ

    Shares of Constellation Brands (STZ +3.5%) rally after the company announces it completed a sale...

    Shares of Constellation Brands (STZ +3.5%) rally after the company announces it completed a sale of $650M in senior notes. Proceeds from the offering are earmarked to help fund the wine seller's purchase of Crown Imports. Also: Stifel Nicolaus ups its price target on STZ to $36 from $32.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • DHI

    D.R. Horton (DHI -1.9%) acquires the homebuilding operations of Breland Homes, which operates in...

    D.R. Horton (DHI -1.9%) acquires the homebuilding operations of Breland Homes, which operates in Huntsville, Mobile and Baldwin County in Alabama and along the gulf coast of Mississippi. The assets include approximately 320 homes in inventory, 1,020 finished lots and control of an additional 3,700 lots through option contracts. Terms of the deal were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings (GNC -2.3%) says it's closed its underwritten offering of 10M shares of its Class A...

    GNC Holdings (GNC -2.3%) says it's closed its underwritten offering of 10M shares of its Class A common stock it announced last Thursday. In tandem, the company also notes it's completed the repurchase of 6M shares of its Class A common stock directly from Ares in a private, non-underwritten transaction.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT +1.7%) powers into positive territory after a Doug Kass tweet speculates...

    Walter Energy (WLT +1.7%) powers into positive territory after a Doug Kass tweet speculates Xstrata (OTC:XSRAF, OTC:XSRAY) is considering a ~$47.50/share bid for the coal producer. Shares had been down 5% earlier in the session.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 4 Comments
  • RGR

    KeyBanc Capital Markets downgrades gun sellers Sturm Ruger (RGR -4.4%) and Smith & Wesson (SWHC...

    KeyBanc Capital Markets downgrades gun sellers Sturm Ruger (RGR -4.4%) and Smith & Wesson (SWHC -7.5%). Forget about any talk about the Obama or Romney election factor, this is a good ole fashioned valuation call as both stocks have run up solid YTD gains and appear to have maxed out profitability. KeyBanc's ratings: SWHC to Hold from Buy, RGR to Underweight from Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 13 Comments
  • QRE

    QR Energy (QRE -1.6%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform at Wells Fargo this morning, saying...

    QR Energy (QRE -1.6%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform at Wells Fargo this morning, saying that distribution growth may prove "challenging" going forward due to higher G&A and interest expenses. The firm cuts its price target range to $17 - $19 from $19 - $21.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • CACH

    Cache (OTC:CACH -3.4%) slumps after losing its cachet with analysts at Piper Jaffray, as they...

    Cache (OTC:CACH -3.4%) slumps after losing its cachet with analysts at Piper Jaffray, as they take their rating on the retailer down to Neutral from Overweight. A core issue for the company is its dependence on mall traffic, which is viewed as weakening.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • GOGL

    Knightsbridge Tankers (VLCCF -6.4%) slides after a big miss on it's Q2 this morning. The company...

    Knightsbridge Tankers (VLCCF -6.4%) slides after a big miss on it's Q2 this morning. The company says it lost $0.13 per share, well below Street estimates of $0.29 per share, largely due to a weak dry bulk market and the unexpected termination of its Golden Zhejiang time charter. It also cut it's quarterly dividend to $0.175 per share, a 50% decrease from the prior year as it struggles with cash flow constraints and heavy spot market exposure.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 6 Comments
  • TGT

    Quick hits from Target's (TGT +1.9%) ongoing earnings CC (webcast): Tips off that early results...

    Quick hits from Target's (TGT +1.9%) ongoing earnings CC (webcast): Tips off that early results from the back-to-school selling season are "positive." Will join retailer payments network. Creating more boutique shops within stores. Pharmacy and Beauty remain two of its fastest growing areas and will see an increased focus. Geek Squad to hit pilot stores in October. Expects to churn up $100B in sales by 2017 and realize EPS of at least $8.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -4.7%) falls on a downgrade to Neutral from Sterne Agee. The solid-state...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -4.7%) falls on a downgrade to Neutral from Sterne Agee. The solid-state drive vendor has more than given back the gains it saw on Seagate acquisition rumors. (CFO retirement)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +10.1%) soars after knocking out a relatively minor earning beat....

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +10.1%) soars after knocking out a relatively minor earning beat. Execs strike a conciliatory tone about strategy on the firm's earnings CC (webcast), which may be helping to lift sentiment along with an increase in the firm's buyback program.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC -5.7%) shares slide after a trifecta of disappointing news this week:...

    InterOil (IOC -5.7%) shares slide after a trifecta of disappointing news this week: disappointing Q2 results, a report of potentially waning interest for its Papua New Guinea exploration licenses, and George Soros' liquidation of his entire 1.6M-share stake in the company. Shares have shed 13.5% on the week.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -4.1%) opens weak with a downgrade from Stifel Nicolaus to Hold from Buy...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -4.1%) opens weak with a downgrade from Stifel Nicolaus to Hold from Buy tipping sentiment. Unsurprisingly, concern over e-book sales is front and center as the company loses one of its stronger bull calls on the Street.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM +3.5%) and Limelight (LLNW +6.8%) jump after Dan Rayburn reports AT&T (NYSE:T)...

    Akamai (AKAM +3.5%) and Limelight (LLNW +6.8%) jump after Dan Rayburn reports AT&T (NYSE:T) is in talks to re-sell CDN services from one of the companies. Rayburn adds the deal "is now Akamai's to lose," but no decision has been made. An AT&T deal would do much to soothe fears among Akamai and Limelight investors of direct competition from major telcos - Rayburn notes neither AT&T nor any other telco has a huge CDN business right now.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +3.4%) settle down after anxiety over new K-cup...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +3.4%) settle down after anxiety over new K-cup pricing fired up a wave of late selling yesterday. Although the company hasn't confirmed it quite yet, it appears Rivo will be the name for a new espresso machine that will debut later this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • JAGGF

    Jaguar Mining (JAG -12.4%) slides after reporting a Q2 loss of $0.19/share vs. an $0.18 profit...

    Jaguar Mining (JAG -12.4%) slides after reporting a Q2 loss of $0.19/share vs. an $0.18 profit in the year-ago quarter. JAG sold 28,933 oz. of gold vs. ~40K oz. a year ago; average cash operating cost/oz. was $1,162 vs. $799 a year ago. JAG lowers its full-year production outlook, now expecting gold production of 110K-120K oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • OXSQ

    TICC Capital's (TICC -2.4%) 3M share secondary prices at $9.65/share (yesterday's close $9.91)...

    TICC Capital's (TICC -2.4%) 3M share secondary prices at $9.65/share (yesterday's close $9.91) for total estimated gross proceeds of $29M. The underwriters have a 30-day option to purchase an additional 450K shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • SPLS

    Staples (SPLS -15.5%) shares open at a nine-year low after missing Q2 estimates and lowering...

    Staples (SPLS -15.5%) shares open at a nine-year low after missing Q2 estimates and lowering FY2013 guidance. Office product retail peers Office Depot (ODP -3.1%) and OfficeMax (OMX -5.6%) also are sharply lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharma (ARNA +4.1%) adds to sharp gains from yesterday as LifeSci Advisors publishes an...

    Arena Pharma (ARNA +4.1%) adds to sharp gains from yesterday as LifeSci Advisors publishes an upbeat note about the stock. LifeSci's main points include Arena possibly receiving a $1.2B one-time purchase price adjustment from its partner Eisai based on net sales of diet drug Belviq.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 7 Comments
  • GEF

    Industrial packaging maker Greif (NYSE:GEF) -5.3% premarket after cutting its full-year earnings...

    Industrial packaging maker Greif (NYSE:GEF) -5.3% premarket after cutting its full-year earnings guidance, hit by lower-than-expected volumes and a slow recovery in its European market during the latest quarter. GEF says rigid-packaging markets in other regions also are being impacted by the slowdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • FACE

    Premarket gainers: FACE +15%. LEE +9%. ANF +7%. JDSU +6%. Losers: SPLS -17%. JAG -12%. CSIQ...

    Premarket gainers: FACE +15%. LEE +9%. ANF +7%. JDSU +6%.
    Losers: SPLS -17%. JAG -12%. CSIQ -12%. CYOU -11%. CPRX -8%. DE -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • NOV

    Warren Buffett's new energy favorites National Oilwell Varco and Phillips 66 look strong in...

    Warren Buffett's new energy favorites National Oilwell Varco and Phillips 66 look strong in premarket trading: NOV +2.5%, PSX +1.7%. Intel (NASDAQ:INTC), whose shares Buffett liquidated in the latest quarter, -0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 2 Comments

  • Market preview: Stock futures stay lower after the NY's Empire State business conditions index...

    Market preview: Stock futures stay lower after the NY's Empire State business conditions index unexpectedly turns negative, while inflation was unchanged in July. The benchmark S&P is -0.2%. Staples (-15.8%) gets un-stapled followings earnings, although Abercrombie & Fitch climbs 4.9% and JDS Uniphase 4.3% after their results. Later: NAHB Housing Market Index, Fed's Kocherlakota
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CSIQ

    More on Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ): Q2 loss of $0.59/share compares with a year-ago profit of...

    More on Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ): Q2 loss of $0.59/share compares with a year-ago profit of $0.16, as average selling prices continued to decline as the euro weakened and Germany transitioned to a new, lower feed-in-tariff regime. Volume was healthy, as solar module shipments rose to 412 mw from 287 mw Y/Y; reaffirms guidance of 1,800-2,000 mw for the year. CSIQ -13.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • FACE

    Physicians Formula Holdings (NASDAQ:FACE) +14.1% premarket after agreeing to be acquired for...

    Physicians Formula Holdings (NASDAQ:FACE) +14.1% premarket after agreeing to be acquired for $4.25/share in cash by Swander Pace Capital in a deal valued at $65M. The price is 15% above the skin care firm's closing level of $3.68/share on Tuesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • SPLS

    Shares of Staples (NASDAQ:SPLS) fall off 11.8% premarket after its Q2 earnings report (I, II)...

    Shares of Staples (NASDAQ:SPLS) fall off 11.8% premarket after its Q2 earnings report (I, II) disappoints. As if slumping sales and lowered guidance wasn't dispiriting enough for the company, it took another kick in the teeth after retailing peer Target came in with strong results for the same quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • DE

    More on Deere (NYSE:DE): Net income +10.6% Y/Y. Equipment sales +16%, equipment operating profit...

    More on Deere (NYSE:DE): Net income +10.6% Y/Y. Equipment sales +16%, equipment operating profit +16.3%. Expects FQ4 and full year sales increase of just 13%. "Global economic conditions and dryness in several key markets warrant some caution in coming months." Shares -5.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 AM | 3 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) shares jump 5.6% premarket after CEO Stephen Elop says the phone maker will...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) shares jump 5.6% premarket after CEO Stephen Elop says the phone maker will launch a Windows 8 smartphone "relatively near term," and doesn't deny that it could be at the company's trade show in Helsinki on Sept. 5-6. That's a week before an Apple event on Sept. 12, when it could unveil a new iPhone.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 AM | 20 Comments

  • European shares track Asia and open mostly lower, with tobacco stock falling after cigarette...

    European shares track Asia and open mostly lower, with tobacco stock falling after cigarette companies lose a ruling in Australia over packaging. BAT -3.25% in London, Imperial Tobacco -1.6%. Euro STOXX 50 -0.4%, London -0.4%, Paris -0.5%, Frankfurt -0.3% and Madrid -0.1%, although Milan is +0.85%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 AM

  • Asian shares are mostly lower, possibly on earnings results, possibly on scaled-back...

    Asian shares are mostly lower, possibly on earnings results, possibly on scaled-back expectations for central bank action. U.S. economic expansion is "at a sufficient pace for the Fed to hold fire," says one economist, while talk that the PBOC will again cut the reserve requirement is "rampant," says an investment manager. Japan -0.1%, Hong Kong -1%, China -0.8%, India +0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 AM | 1 Comment
